          Bio
          Hello! I am Yuhao Min, a Ph.D. candidate at the Nilüfer
          Ertekin-Taner Lab at Mayo Clinic. My research focus on
          understanding the complex molecular and cellular changes in
          neurodegenerative brains using systems biology tools, and
          translating the findings into therapeutic targets.
          As an undergraduate student atUniversity of Illinois at
          Urbana-Champaign, I worked at the Huimin Zhao
          Lab to help develop better tools for synthetic biology
          applications.
          
          
          Education
          
          Mayo Clinic Graduate School of
          Biomedical Sciences
          Jacksonville, FL | 2019 - Present
          Ph.D. in Clinic and Translational Sciecnes
          
          
          University of Illinois at
          Urbana-Chamaign
          Urbana, IL | 2014 - 2019
          B.S. in Chemistry | B.S. in Molecular and Cellular Biology
          | Minor in Computer Science
          
          
          
          Experience
          
          Graduate Research
          Assistant
          Nilüfer
          Ertekin-Taner Lab | 2020 - Present
          
          
          Undergraduate Research
          Assistant
          Huimin
          Zhao Lab | 2015 - 2018
